sect1.title: Synopsis
sect1.para: The VAMPzero initializer provides a tool to create an input data set for the conceptual aircraft design tool VAMPzero via a user-friendly graphical interface. The output consists of a CPACS file that can be forwarded to a copy of VAMPzero.

sect1.title: Rationale
sect1.para: The basic idea is that RCE in combination with the Common Parametric Aircraft Configuration Schema (CPACS) and the conceptual aircraft design code VAMPzero enable new users to easily start their aircraft design. Hence, it is important to provide means to easily manipulate the input settings of VAMPzero without being forced to interact with the CPACS file directly. In consequence, the VAMPzero Initializer fulfils this task, as it can create new or manipulate existing input data sets for VAMPzero. The output of the VAMPzero Initializer is a CPACS file that contains the <toolspecific> input for VAMPzero. Hence, an identical file can be created manually. In a subsequent step the file needs to be forwarded to an instance of VAMPzero to perform the conceptual aircraft design.

All input values of VAMPzero are available. Nevertheless, there is no check whether the input setting is actually reasonable or not. For further information on VAMPzero and its parameters please visit: https://software.dlr.de/p/vampzero/home/

sect1.title: Usage
sect1.para: On the "Initialization" tab in the properties view you may edit or define new parameters to the aircraft. Each parameter, e.g., reference Area, is adjacent to a component, e.g., wing, and a discipline, e.g., geometry. Hence, first the component and the discipline must be selected to obtain a list of possible inputs. If you want to remove a parameter from an input set you may use the revert button.
You may either enter a value or a factor. A value overwrites VAMPzero's initial value. A factor is simply multiplicated to the VAMPzero calculation method, much like a normal technology factor.
Via the load configuration button it is possible to load a pre-defined set of input values.

To finalize the input data set you must press the "Create CPACS" button. The output of the VAMPzero Initializer component may then be connected via the draw connection tool to another instance of VAMPzero.
